item.title: How to make a click command in C++?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:3, topic:290592”]What don’t you understand about this, tyman33? DarkGDK IS NOT C++, it is a library. You are not asking C++ questions, you are asking LIBRARY SPECIFIC questions. Therefore, go to the libraries forum, as they will be able to assist you far more than ourselves.
Try here: http://forum.thegamecreators.com/

super_ stop sucking up.[/quote]

I’m not sucking up, I found a nice DarkGDK reference and I decided I’d help him out

(If you’re wondering, it’s http://dotnetx.betasafe.com/johnspink/darkgdk/commands/)

Read full topic

item.title: How to make a click command in C++?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

if (dbMouseClick()) { //was there a mouse click?
    int x = dbMouseX(); //if so, get its
    int y = dbMouseY(); //x, y coordinates
    if (x >= ... && x <= ...
        && y >= ... && y <= ...) { //bounds checking
        //handle mouse click
    }
}

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a click command in C++?

item.title: How to make a click command in C++?
item.dc:creator: @tyman33 tyman33
item.description:
@tyman33 wrote:

im trying to make a game that deals with the mouse… how can i make a click command… Here is my source code for my game…

And when i left click the moving object i want to make it disapear… Please help me… Message me a tut or comment this.

#include “DarkGDK.h”

void DarkGDK ( void )
{
dbSyncOn ( );
dbSyncRate ( 60 );

dbLoadImage ( "GamePicture.png", 1 );
dbSprite ( 1, 0, 0, 1 );

	for ( int i = 2; i < 30; i++ )
	{
	dbCreateAnimatedSprite ( i, "Untitled1110.bmp", 4, 4, i );
	dbSprite ( i, dbRnd ( 640 ), -dbRnd ( 1500 ), i );
	}


while ( LoopGDK ( ) )
{	
	for ( int i = 2; i < 30; i++ )
	{
	dbMoveSprite ( i, -2 );
	dbPlaySprite ( i, 1, 16, 60 );
	if ( dbSpriteY ( i ) > 500 )
    dbSprite ( i, dbRnd ( 640 ), -dbRnd ( 1500 ), i );
	}
	dbSync ( );


}
return;

}

Read full topic
item.source: How to make a click command in C++?
